Bleeding in late pregnancy
The most common sort of 
bleeding in late pregnancy 
is the small amount of blood 
mixed with mucus that is 
known as a ‘show’. This 
is a sign that the cervix is 
changing and becoming ready 
for labour to start. It may 
happen a few days before 
contractions start or during 
labour itself.
Deep vein thrombosis
Deep vein thrombosis is a 
serious condition where clots 
develop,  often in the deep 
veins of the legs. It can be
